msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of the texts; two initial lines of each section; initial lines of Psalms; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; abbreviations alternating with letters in black (e.g., fols. 9ra, 22rb, 23ra); words, e.g., wä-yǝwgǝr ʿǝṭanä (fol. 8rb), wä-yǝʿud (fol. 8rb), täwäkäf (fol. 8va), ʾaʾakkwǝto (fol. 10ra-b), wä-yǝblu (e.g., fols. 18va, 19rb, 20ra), burake (e.g., fols. 31vb, 33rb, 34rb); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

msItem.note: - I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual”
I-1) Ṣälotä ʾǝṭan “Ritual of the Incense” (fols. 3ra-10vb)
I-2) Admonition to be read over all the dead (fols. 11ra-14vb)
I-3) Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 15ra-17vb)
I-4) Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17vb-23rb)
I-5) Laʿlä kwǝllomu mǝwwǝtan, Reading over all the dead (fols. 23va-26va);
I-6) Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 26va-38vb)
I-7) Prayer of penitence that God gave to Peter (fols. 38vb-39vb)
I-8) Anonymous homily on burial (fols. 39vb-40rb)
I-9) Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 40rb-42rb)

I-10) Burial ritual for: metropolitans (fols. 42rb-43ra); qomosat (fols. 43ra-44rb); priests (fols. 44rb-45va); deacons (fols. 45va-46vb); monks (fols. 46vb-48rb); young fathers (fols. 48rb-49vb); children (fols. 49vb-51ra); nuns (fols. 51ra-51vb); old women (fols. 51vb-52vb); little girls (fols. 52vb-53vb);

I-11) Readings: on the day when the person died (fols. 53vb-55ra); on the third day (fols. 55rb-56ra); on the seventh day (fols. 56ra-56vb); on the twelfth day (fols. 56vb-57vb); on the thirtieth day (fols. 57vb-58vb); on the fortieth, sixtieth and eightieth days, and on the sixth month (fols. 58vb-62vb)
I-12) Homily of St. Jacob of Sarug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 62vb-66rb)
I-13) The story of the wealthy man who did not fear God (fols. 66rb-69ra)
I-14) Ṣälotä nǝssǝḥa “Prayer of Penitence” (fols. 69ra-73vb)
I-15) Lǝfafä ṣǝdǝq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 73vb-77vb)
I-16) Ṣälotä burake zä-ʾabunä Samuʾel “Prayer of Benediction by ʾabunä Samuʾel” (fols. 77vb-79ra)
I-17) Short hymn and supplication (Kǝśtätä ʾaryam with Musical notation), performed for the funeral of different categories of Christians (fols. 79ra-80vb)
I-18) Burake zä-ʾanǝst “Benediction of the woman” (fols. 83ra-84rb)
- Antiphons (Kǝśtätä ʾaryam, mäwaśǝʾt) contain interlineal musical signs.

list.item: Fol. 10vb: Ownership note.Fol. 10vb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ አቡሁ፡ ተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ወስመ፡ እሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡፡ Fol. 10vb: This book is of Wäldä Mikaʾel, his father is Täsfa Maryam and the name of his mother is Wälätta Mikaʾel. The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 2 and the names in the supplication formulas.

Fol. 84rb: Donation note.Fol. 84rb: ˂…˃ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ˂…˃፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ አቡሁ፡ ተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ዓመተ፡ ሚካኤል፡፡ Fol. 84rb: [This] book is of St. Michael ˂…˃, which Wäldä Mikaʾel donated. His father is Täsfa Maryam [and his … is] ʿAmätä Mikaʾel. The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 1 and the names in the supplication formulas.

Fol. 84va: Donation note. Fol. 84va: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘመድኃኒ፡ ዓለም፡ አዲግራት፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ዳግማዊ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ዓመተ፡ ድንግል፡ ከመ፡ ይኵኖሙ፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግስተ፡ ሰማያት፡፡ Fol. 84va: This book is of ʾAddigrat Mädḫani ʿAläm which Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus donated and his wife is ʿAmätä Dǝngǝl, so that it might be for them a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. The note is written in vivid scarlet, but in a finer hand, different from that of Additiones 1-2. It states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus whose wife is ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. The note states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. The note is written in the same hand as the donation note in Ms. AMM-001 (s. Additio 2) and, most probably, the donation note in Mss. AMM-005, AMM-006.

origin.origDate: The Patriarch of Alexandria (liqä ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabba Marqos (in tenure ) and Metropolitan (ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabba Matewos (in tenure ) and King Yoḥannǝs (r. ) are mentioned in the supplication formulas on fol. 40rb.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased from the supplication formulas and replaced with the names of Wäldä Mikaʾel, Täsfa Maryam and Wälätta Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 14vb, 38ra, 52vb), Wäldä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fol. 61vb), Gäbrä Ḥǝywot (e.g., fol. 62ra), Kǝnfä Mikaʾel (e.g., fol. 61va). The first three names are also mentioned in Additiones 1 and 2. All the names have been added by a secondary hand, in vivid scarlet. According to Additio 3, the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus might be identified with the second son of däğğazmač Säbagadis (1770-1831), Ḫagos (d. 1831). The identification is based on Additiones 1 and 2 in Ms. FBM-002. He also donated Ms. FBM-009.
